module.name: HTML
module.param:
test with serialized context

$search$
earliest=$search.timeRange.earliest$
latest=$search.timeRange.latest$

sid=$results.sid$

module.name: HTML
module.param:
test with scheduled search, default useHistory

$search$
earliest=$search.timeRange.earliest$
latest=$search.timeRange.latest$
results.count=$results.count$
results.eventCount=$results.eventCount$
results.resultCount=$results.resultCount$
results.scanCount=$results.scanCount$
results.eventAvailableCount=$results.eventAvailableCount$
results.eventFieldCount=$results.eventFieldCount$
results.runDuration=$results.runDuration$

sid=$results.sid$

module.name: HTML
module.param:
test with scheduled search, useHistory=True

$search$
earliest=$search.timeRange.earliest$
latest=$search.timeRange.latest$
results.count=$results.count$
results.eventCount=$results.eventCount$
results.resultCount=$results.resultCount$
results.scanCount=$results.scanCount$
results.eventAvailableCount=$results.eventAvailableCount$
results.eventFieldCount=$results.eventFieldCount$
results.runDuration=$results.runDuration$

sid=$results.sid$

module.name: HTML
module.param:
NOTE - these rtsearch savedsearches have to ship in savedsearches.conf with their actual realtime timeranges changed to historical timeranges. To get this testcase to be meaningful you will have to go make those into realtime timeranges in savedsearches.conf

test with realtime scheduled search, default useHistory

$search$
earliest=$search.timeRange.earliest$
latest=$search.timeRange.latest$
results.count=$results.count$
results.eventCount=$results.eventCount$
results.resultCount=$results.resultCount$
results.scanCount=$results.scanCount$
results.eventAvailableCount=$results.eventAvailableCount$
results.eventFieldCount=$results.eventFieldCount$
results.runDuration=$results.runDuration$

sid=$results.sid$
